key_title: Key to the genera of Ranunculaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Ranunculaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Ranunculaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plants rosetted or creeping (or aquatic), herbaceous; leaves alternate or rosetted; styles not plumose; flowers bisexual
Plants climbing, woody at base; leaves opposite; styles plumose, elongating in fruit; plants mostly dioecious
Flowering stems with a whorl of involucral of bracts (bracts often leaf-like and sometimes subtending the petiole)
Flowering stems without a whorl of involucral bracts
Flowers terminal and solitary on erect stems, immediately subtended by an involucre of leaf-like bracts; fruit a 5-beaked capsule formed from several united folicles
Flowers terminal, solitary or in umbels of 2–5; involucre distant from flowers (often subtending the petiole); fruit an achene
[link through]
[link through]
Flowers prominently spurred; fruits of 1 or more follicles; escapes from horticulture
Flowers not or hardly spurred; fruit an achene (several to many aggregated in heads or spikes), or a head of follicles (in alpine Psychrophila)
Flowers actinomorphic; fruit a head of several follicles
Flowers zygomorphic; fruit a single follicle
[link through]
Fruiting head or spike composed of achenes; perianth in 2 distinct whorls (but segments sometimes early-deciduous), petals white, yellow or red
Fruit a head of sessile, radiating, several-seeded follicles; perianth segments in 1 whorl, white or pinkish; fleshy alpine herb usually flowering during or soon after snow-melt
Sepals attached basally or nearly so; fruiting receptacle discoid to oblong, but never more than 4 times longer than wide
Sepals apparently peltately attached, the basal spur almost as long as the upper part; achenes densely arranged on a slender, spike-like receptacle many times longer than wide
Petals yellow or white; nectaries present; leaves various
Petals red, blotched darker near base; nectaries absent; leaves finely divided
Sepals 5; leaves variously divided, or if entire, then attenuate at base
Sepals 3; leaves simple, broadly ovate to reniform, cordate at base
[link through]
[link through]
